title: Jean Perrier et Fils 2015 Abymes Cuvée Gastronomie Jacquère (Savoie)
description: This is a ripe, fruity wine with attractive acidity as well a tangy character. It is fresh, crisp and ready to go with its apple and lemon flavors. Drink now.

title: Jean Perrier et Fils 2015 Cuvée Gastronomie Mondeuse (Savoie)
description: With its stalky edge and red fruits, this crisp red wine has acidity, some tight tannins and a juicy aftertaste. It is ready to drink young, possibly slightly chilled.

title: Junta 2013 Late Harvest Semillon (Central Valley)
description: Peach, caramel and honeyed aromas turn a bit soapy and powdery with airing. Plump to the point of being a bit flabby, this Semillón tastes of apricot, cinnamon and cocoa, while the finish is sweet like honey.

title: Les Rocailles 2015 Apremont Jacquère (Vin de Savoie)
description: Lively and crisp, this delicious, snow-fresh wine has apple and melon flavors over aromatic acidity. With its bright texture and lightly herbal edge it is a refreshing wine to drink now.

title: Market Vineyards 2014 Liquidity White (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is equal parts Viognier and Roussanne. It offers light aromas of peach and apricot that are followed by full-bodied flavors that show some warmth and bitterness on the finish.

title: Gimenez Mendez 2015 100 Años Viñas Mendoza Malbec (Montevideo)
description: Inky cool herbal black-fruit aromas set up a choppy tight palate with pounding tannins. Flavors of black coffee and blackberry are heavily toasted. The finish keeps that toasty theme while introducing notes of pepper and horseradish.

title: Gimenez Mendez 2015 Las Brujas Red (Canelones)
description: Inky purple in color, with herbal, minty, toasty berry aromas that suggest a touch of green, this Tannat-Malbec blend tastes of rooty, baked black fruits and black pepper. On the finish, which is hard as rocks, this tastes of licorice and burnt toast.

title: Domaine du Petit Coteau 2015 Sec  (Vouvray)
description: This ripe, apple-flavored wine has delicious, crisp fruit. It's creamy, with a clean line of acidity and an aftertaste that adds green plums to the general fruitiness. Drink this wine now.

title: Domaine Maestracci 2015 Clos Reginu Red (Corse Calvi)
description: This blend that seems to include every Corsican and Provence red grape works out as a wild and wonderful wine. With acidity, spice, perfume and tannins that bring in a bramble texture, this is a wine for drinking young.

title: Domaine Maillard 2014  Chorey-lès-Beaune
description: Chorey-lès-Beaune is able to produce small quantities of white as well as red. This wine, soft and now ripely ready to drink, is fat and full with yellow fruits and just enough acidity to balance. It is an easy, open wine, finishing with a hint of mineral texture.

title: Four Sisters Ranch 2014 Albariño (Paso Robles)
description: Broad green apple and grapefruit-pith aromas mesh with lemon-lime soda, grass and cut weeds on the nose of this bottling. A steely structure and sizzle of acidity present grassy flavors on the tightly wound palate.

title: Heron Hill 2014 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)
description: Pronounced aromas of smoke and char on the nose of this Cabernet Franc ease into prettier black plum and cherry aromas with a bit of air and patience. Its lusciously ripe style is easy and accessible but subtle complexities of smoke, bramble and nuts make it elegant. Finely textured tannins frame the finish softly.

title: Domaines Devillard 2014 Château de Chamirey  (Mercurey)
description: A blend of village and Premier Cru wines produce this soft gently tannic and fruity wine. It does have structure with a dry core, although that is surrounded with red currant and blackberry fruits. It has a mineral edge that will allow it to age. Drink from 2018.

title: Ochagavia 2014 Raíces Nobles Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Perfumed, soapy aromas of berry fruits and grainy oak announce a palate that comes up a bit empty. Flavors of chocolaty oak and caramel overshadow generic berry fruit, while this is firm on the finish, with herbal overtones and a note of olive.

title: Olivier Leflaive 2014  Bourgogne Aligoté
description: With its rich texture, this could almost be a Chardonnay. The acidity and the steely texture makes the difference. It gives the wine an open fruitiness—very citrus and sliced green apples. The wine is fresh and deliciously crisp. Drink now.

title: Roche de Bellene 2014  Saint-Véran
description: This is a new wine from this negociant house that specializes in limited production wines. It is a smooth and rounded wine, ripe with apples and yellow fruits as well as being cut with acidity. The wine is refreshing and crisp at the end with a touch of minerality.

title: Roche de Bellene 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)
description: This wine is produced from vines aged 62–88 years old. It has ripe red fruits and soft tannins creating a wine that is generous and ready to drink. It is a blend of grapes from the flat lands beyond the slopes in the Côte d'Or. The wine finishes with acidity as well as attractive fruitiness.

title: Rooster Hill 2014 Barrel Reserve Pinot Noir (Finger Lakes)
description: Subtle whiffs of rose petal, spice and earth entice on the nose of this rustic but pretty Pinot Noir. Lush in body, the palate suggests ruddy plum and cherry flavors shaded in tones of leather, smoked meat and balsamic. Finely grained tannins frame a long finish.

title: EOS 2014 Betrayal Red (Central Coast)
description: There's a candied-strawberry aroma on this wine, lifted by incense and pine-sap notes that tickle the nose. It's soft and full on the sip, with plush red-fruit flavors of candied raspberry and cranberry, with thyme herbs and a generous acidity.

title: Resolute 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Hills Lake County)
description: A heavy perfume of toasted oak leads to almost sweet fruit flavors enhanced with vanilla, maple syrup and smoke from aging with oak. The wine is full bodied, with medium depth.

title: Magistrate 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Fresh-pressed boysenberries give zest to dusty aromas of tobacco and strong shoe leather on the nose of this bottling. Tobacco shows powerfully on the palate, as do dill, marjoram and black pepper. Dark fruit, from blackcurrant to elderberry, provides the base.

title: Marichal 2014 Premium Varietal Tannat (Canelones)
description: Reticent berry aromas are dusty like a warm radiator. This Tannat feels healthy but regular, with a medium-bodied palate. Slightly salty plum and berry flavors are lightly herbal on the finish.

title: Maryhill 2013 Vineyard Series Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: This wine is a blend of McKinley Springs and Alder Ridge fruit. Coffee and cherry aromas lead to restrained cranberry flavors, with the tannins bringing some dryness and grit.

title: Rocca Bernarda 2015  Soave Classico
description: Honeysuckle, white stone fruit and honeydew melon aromas lift out of the glass. The round, easy-drinking palate offers Granny Smith apple and white grapefruit. It finishes clean and fresh.

title: Rumelia Wine Cellar 2012 Merul Reserve Mavrud (Thracian Valley)
description: Leather, black plum and black raspberry pave the way for flavors of black plum, cassis and tobacco leaf. There's a good amount of weight in the midpalate with a silky smooth finish.

title: Pride Mountain 2015 Viognier (Sonoma County)
description: Fermented and aged in neutral French oak, this 100% varietal white is voluptuous and viscous, quite full-bodied in style and statement. Spicy acidity helps keep it fresh in the glass, showcasing a wealth of honeyed peach and lemon meringue.

title: Midnight 2013 Nebula Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Blueberry, black cherry and tobacco show on the nose of this bottling, although it is quite reserved on the nose and the palate. Blueberry and dark chocolate flavors manage to break through the structured, mouthfilling tannins that are silky but strong. This wine still needs time to emerge.

title: Gunsight Rock 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Tart Montmorency cherry meshes with a cedary cigar-box note on the nose of this wine. The palate is fruit-driven with ripe cherries and blueberries, lifted slightly by anise and bay-leaf spices.

title: Hector Wine Company 2014 Cabernet Franc (Seneca Lake)
description: Hints of roasted beet and forest floor lend rusticity to ripe red cherry and plum in this full-bodied Cabernet Franc. Crisp acidity lifts and lightens the midpalate. Smooth supple tannins and a hint of truffle linger on the finish.

title: Henri Bourgeois 2013 Les Baronnes  (Sancerre)
description: This is a lighter style of Pinot Noir than some produced in Sancerre today. It brings out perfumes and red-cherry flavors lifted by acidity. The wine is fruity, with hints of wood aging and a juicy aftertaste. Drink now.
